page.title: 12COASTAL DEFENCES
page.content: IN BREAN THERE ARE ABOUT 20 PILL BOXES SCATTERED ALONG THE COAST AND THE SURROUNDING COUNTRY SIDE ALONG SOME OF THE ROADS AND RIVERS.THEY WERE MANNED AND LOOKED AFTER BY THE HOME GUARD AND THE REGULAR ARMY.THEY WOULD HAVE BEEN USED TO DETER AN INVASION BY THE GERMAN ARMY COMING UP THE BRISTOL CHANNEL AND LANDING ON BERROW,BREAN AND BURNHAM BEACH. ON THE SAND ON BREAN BEACH THEY PUT CONCRETE BLOCKS INTO THE SAND TO RIP THE BOTTOM OF THE BOATS THAT MAY TRY TO LAND ON THE BEACH. THERE WAS A FORT AT BREAN WHICH WAS A VITAL ARTILLARY IMPLACEMENT TO STOP THE GERMAN NAVY FROM GOING UP THE CHANNEL.IT WAS LINKED WITH A SIMULAR GUN IMPLACEMENT ON AN ISLAND COULD STEEP-HOLME.TOGETHER THEY COULD SEAL OFF THE BRISTOL CHANNEL.
